translations: n．杂乱，混乱：杂乱无章的物品堆积或混乱的状态。
· There are too many clutters in this room.
这个房间里杂乱的东西太多了。
v．使杂乱，弄乱：使空间或地方变得杂乱无章。

sentences.sentence: White space de-clutters a page by giving items room to breathe.
sentences.translation: 空白通过给各元素足够的空间来“呼吸”以避免页面过于拥挤凌乱。

sentences.sentence: He still thinks about the Clutters often, hence his idea for the memorial.
sentences.translation: 他常常会想起克拉特一家，于是就有了立铭牌的想法。

sentences.sentence: Describing business rules in the flows of the use cases usually clutters the use-case specifications.
sentences.translation: 在用例流中描述业务规则通常会把用例规格弄得混乱。
